dt: {bc}a usually raised structure or place on which sacrifices are offered or incense is burned in worship
often used figuratively to describe a thing given great or undue precedence or value especially at the cost of something else

dt.t: sacrificed his family life on the {wi}altar{/wi} of career advancement

dt: {bc}a tablelike construction used in the Christian church in celebrating the Eucharist
{bc}a table or place which serves as a center of worship or ritual
often used with {it}the{/it} to refer to the act of getting married

dt.t: She {phrase}left him at the altar{/phrase}. {gloss}=she decided at the last minute not to go through with her planned marriage to him{/gloss}

et: Middle English {it}alter{/it}, from Old English {it}altar{/it}, from Latin {it}altare{/it}; probably akin to Latin {it}adolēre{/it} to burn up
shortdef: a usually raised structure or place on which sacrifices are offered or incense is burned in worship —often used figuratively to describe a thing given great or undue precedence or value especially at the cost of something else
a tablelike construction used in the Christian church in celebrating the Eucharist
a table or place which serves as a center of worship or ritual—often used with the to refer to the act of getting married

dt: {bc}a boy who assists the celebrant in a liturgical service

dt.t: No one expects … the trendsetter and party animal to become an {wi}altar boy{/wi}.

dt: typically used in negative constructions to describe a man whose behavior is not entirely admirable or blameless

dt.t: A long time ago she married a man who turns out, by his own admission, to be somewhat dishonest—not a killer, not a dope peddler, but no {wi}altar boy{/wi}, either.

shortdef: a boy who assists the celebrant in a liturgical service
a morally pure and virtuous person —typically used in negative constructions to describe a man whose behavior is not entirely admirable or blameless

dt: {bc}an appeal by an evangelist to worshippers to come forward to signify their decision to commit their lives to Christ

shortdef: an appeal by an evangelist to worshippers to come forward to signify their decision to commit their lives to Christ

dt: {bc}a girl acting as a lay assistant in church services

shortdef: a girl acting as a lay assistant in church services

dt: {bc}a railing in front of an altar separating the chancel from the body of the church

shortdef: a railing in front of an altar separating the chancel from the body of the church

dt: {bc}a lay person (typically a child or adolescent) who assists the celebrant in a liturgical service

shortdef: a lay person (typically a child or adolescent) who assists the celebrant in a liturgical service

dt: {bc}a stone slab with a compartment containing the relics of martyrs that forms an essential part of a Roman Catholic altar

shortdef: a stone slab with a compartment containing the relics of martyrs that forms an essential part of a Roman Catholic altar
the principal altar in a church

dt.t: They started a romance that eventually {it}led{/it} (them) {it}to the altar{/it}.
